snippet: In January, the Supreme Court will hear arguments on whether a person convicted of possessing child pornography can be ordered to pay full restitution to the victim.
abstract: Adam Liptak Sidebar column examines details of Supreme Court case that will decide whether person convicted of possessing child pornography can be ordered to pay full restitution to the victim; notes that alternative is for liability to be split up fractionally among those convicted of possessing the material.
lead_paragraph: In January, the Supreme Court will hear arguments on whether a person convicted of possessing child pornography can be ordered to pay full restitution to the victim.

headline.print_headline: Allocating Liability for Child Pornography, in Full or Fractional Shares
headline.main: Allocating Liability for Child Pornography, in Full or Fractional Shares
